Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.misc.functions

Class Either<L,R>

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.misc.functions.Either<L,R>
Type Parameters:
L - the type of the left value
R - the type of the right value
public final class Either<L,R> extends Object
A generic container that represents one of two possible types of values: a left value (L) or a right value (R). This class can be used to model computations or data that may yield a result in two distinct forms, such as success and failure.

  • Method Details

    • left

      public static <L, R> Either<L,R> left(L value)
      Creates an `Either` representing a left value.
      Type Parameters:
      L - the type of the left value
      R - the type of the right value
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be wrapped as the left value
      Returns:
      an `Either` containing the given left value

    • right

      public static <L, R> Either<L,R> right(R value)
      Creates an `Either` representing a right value.
      Type Parameters:
      L - the type of the left value
      R - the type of the right value
      Parameters:
      value - the value to be wrapped as the right value
      Returns:
      an `Either` containing the given right value

    • isRight

      public boolean isRight()
      Determines whether this instance represents a right value.
      Returns:
      true if this instance contains a right value and no left value, false otherwise

    • getRight

      public R getRight()
      Retrieves the right value contained in this Either instance, if it exists. If this Either represents a left value, this method returns null.

      CONSIDER throwing an Exception if this is a left value.

      Returns:
      the right value if present, otherwise null

    • getLeft

      public L getLeft()
      Retrieves the left value contained in this Either instance, if it exists. If this Either represents a right value, this method returns null.

      CONSIDER throwing an Exception if this is a right value.

      Returns:
      the left value if present, otherwise null

    • map

      public <T> T map(Function<? super L,? extends T> lFunc, Function<? super R,? extends T> rFunc)
      Applies the provided transformation functions to the value contained in the `Either` instance. If the `Either` contains a left value, the `lFunc` function is applied to it. If the `Either` contains a right value, the `rFunc` function is applied to it.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the resulting value
      Parameters:
      lFunc - the function to be applied if this `Either` contains a left value
      rFunc - the function to be applied if this `Either` contains a right value
      Returns:
      the result of applying the appropriate function (either `lFunc` or `rFunc`) to the value contained in the `Either`

    • mapLeft

      public <T> Either<T,R> mapLeft(Function<? super L,? extends T> lFunc)
      Applies the provided function to the left value of this `Either` if it exists. If this `Either` instance contains a right value, it remains unchanged.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the new left value after applying the function
      Parameters:
      lFunc - the function to apply to the left value if present
      Returns:
      a new `Either` containing the transformed left value, or the original right value if no left value is present

    • mapRight

      public <T> Either<L,T> mapRight(Function<? super R,? extends T> rFunc)
      Applies the provided function to the right value of this `Either` if it exists. If this `Either` instance contains a left value, it remains unchanged.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the new right value after applying the function
      Parameters:
      rFunc - the function to apply to the right value if present
      Returns:
      a new `Either` containing the transformed right value, or the original left value if no right value is present

    • apply

      public void apply(Consumer<? super L> lFunc, Consumer<? super R> rFunc)
      Applies the provided consumers to the value contained in this `Either` instance. If the `Either` contains a left value, the `lFunc` consumer is applied to it. If the `Either` contains a right value, the `rFunc` consumer is applied to it.
      Parameters:
      lFunc - the consumer to be applied if this `Either` contains a left value
      rFunc - the consumer to be applied if this `Either` contains a right value
